titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Paul Garris, Judgment
CWG10842

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Nelson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Paul Garris

The Grand Jury of Nelson County in the Name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Paul Garris of the offence of Attempting to entice and persuade away from the Services of her master a certain slave named Savilla the property of John Dawson while in the possession of said John Dawson against the Peace and the dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

"Defendant not appearing tho called It is ordered that the bail bond be and the same is hereby declared forfeited and that process issue theron -- And on further motion It is ordered that a bench warrant issue endorsed that he be admitted to bail in the sum of $600 for his appearance --

And again in Court March 25th 1862 The process herein having been duly served on the Deft Jos -- Herrin and he not appearing It is addressed by the court that he
Plff recover of said Deft the Sum of Five Hundred Dollars the amount of the Bail Bond forfeited herein and may have Execution with costs &c

A Copy Attest
Wm H Slaughter
Clk N C C
